Posts.EditableText: Do you have some infos for us about the iPhone-Version? Will it be possible, to create iPhone-versions of our games from Q5 automatically? Does it support sounds and pics? If yes, must I adjust  resolution or width/height? Is there a maximum filesize of an iPhone-game?
Posts.HTML: Do you have some infos for us about the iPhone-Version? Will it be possible, to create iPhone-versions of our games from Q5 automatically? Does it support sounds and pics? If yes, must I adjust  resolution or width/height? Is there a maximum filesize of an iPhone-game?

Posts.EditableText: Coming to Android soon: https://twitter.com/?photo_id=1#!/alexw ... 52/photo/1 I will blog about this and write some proper documentation when the first app is released. But to answer your questions: - no, this will not be automatic. If you want to turn your game into an app, you'll need to contact me, and I'll work with you to create the app version. There shouldn't be too much work required on your part, but I want to ensure the apps are of a high enough quality, so for example it should be possible to complete the game entirely using hyperlinks. I can also customise the UI for each game. - yes, pictures and sounds are supported. - no need to adjust resolution, the pictures will be resized automatically. Worth making sure the aspect ratio is sensible for a phone though, as you don't want the picture to be too tall. - no maximum file size, as apps can be as big as they like (I think the limit for downloading an app over 3G is 10MB, so maybe worth bearing that in mind)
Posts.HTML:
Coming to Android soon: https://twitter.com/?photo_id=1#!/alexw ... 52/photo/1

I will blog about this and write some proper documentation when the first app is released. But to answer your questions:

- no, this will not be automatic. If you want to turn your game into an app, you'll need to contact me, and I'll work with you to create the app version. There shouldn't be too much work required on your part, but I want to ensure the apps are of a high enough quality, so for example it should be possible to complete the game entirely using hyperlinks. I can also customise the UI for each game.
- yes, pictures and sounds are supported.
- no need to adjust resolution, the pictures will be resized automatically. Worth making sure the aspect ratio is sensible for a phone though, as you don't want the picture to be too tall.
- no maximum file size, as apps can be as big as they like (I think the limit for downloading an app over 3G is 10MB, so maybe worth bearing that in mind)
